intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. ramulosum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of leaves that are often hairy and lobed. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are alternate, with a rough texture and serrated edges, and it has a fibrous root system. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and waste areas.
